Wire end-to-end Node.js<->Python bridge with GPT-5.2, 15 cognitive loops, and scheduler

Full 8-phase implementation connecting the Node.js infrastructure layer \(daemon,
workers, message bus, scheduler\) to the Python cognitive layer \(15 loops, memory
system, Gmail, Twilio, TTS\) via a JSON-RPC stdin/stdout bridge.

New files:
- python_bridge.py: Python JSON-RPC server with 35 handlers \(memory, LLM, Gmail,

- python-bridge.js: Node.js bridge client \(master\) + worker proxy \(IPC\)
- openai_client.py: GPT-5.2 wrapper singleton for all Python loops
- loop_adapters.py: Lazy-init adapters for all 15 cognitive loops
- src/declarations.d.ts: Type declarations for sqlite3

Key changes:
- daemon-master.js: Bridge startup, IPC routing, state persistence to memory DB
- message-bus.js: python-bridge-request/response routing
- agent-loop-worker.js: All actions wired through bridge \(GPT-5.2, Gmail, Twilio, TTS\)
- io-worker.js: Services delegate to bridge or compiled TS BrowserPool
- task-worker.js: All 9 handlers wired through bridge
- health-monitor.js: Real cluster worker counts, Python bridge health check

- src/agent-loops.ts: 15 operational + 15 cognitive loops + 6 cron jobs = 36 total

- src/retry-mechanism.ts: Fixed Partial<RetryConfig> typing
- src/persistence.ts: Fixed sqlite3 import

- tsconfig.json: Added DOM lib, root-level TS files
- package.json: Fixed node-windows and azure deps, added build scripts
- .gitignore: Added dist/, __pycache__/, logs/, data/, .env
